<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>**Summarizing Front-End Issues**

---

Here is a high-level audit of the repository, focused on the kinds of structural problems you asked about (duplicates, missing / unfinished logic, inconsistencies, redundancy, ‚Äúyet-to-be-implemented‚Äù tech, etc.).  I did not execute the code ‚Äì the findings are based on static inspection.

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
1. Duplicate / orphaned directories & files
   ‚Ä¢ frontend/frontend/ ‚Ä¶  
     A second, almost-empty React project lives inside the first one (only an empty src/features and scripts folder).  
     ‚ûú Almost certainly a left-over copy; delete this tree or merge anything valuable.

   ‚Ä¢ Mixed-case ‚ÄúUI / ui‚Äù component folders  
     ‚Äì Lower-case:  frontend/src/components/ui/*  
     ‚Äì Upper-case:  frontend/src/components/UI/*  
     Imports in ~30 component files now point to ‚Äú../UI/‚Ä¶‚Äù while many actual files are still in ‚Äúui/‚Ä¶‚Äù.  
     ‚ûú Runtime will fail on *nix hosts; choose one casing, move/rename the files, and run the `fix-ui-imports.js` script (or replace the import paths manually).

2. Front-end logic that is present in files but not wired up
   ‚Ä¢ App.js only renders a placeholder header; none of the pages in components/* are routed.  
   ‚Ä¢ No <Routes>/<Route> declarations other than the Router wrapper.  
   ‚Ä¢ The ‚Äúlazy-components‚Äù, ‚Äúhooks/use-dynamic-import‚Äù, and CODE-SPLITTING-GUIDE.md exist, but the hooks are never used inside App.  
   ‚Ä¢ i18n is configured (src/i18n/config.js) and `useTranslation()` is imported in a few pages, yet those pages are not reachable because routing is missing.

3. Missing components referenced in code
   ‚Ä¢ Many pages import `<Skeleton>`, `<Card>`, `<Button>`, etc. from the UI folder(s), but the corresponding component files are **not** present for several imports (e.g. Skeleton, Card, Grid, Table, etc.).  
   ‚ûú Either add the components or remove the imports; otherwise tree-shaking will break at build time.

4. Script artefacts
   ‚Ä¢ frontend/scripts/fix-ui-imports.js, rename-to-kebab-case.js, enforce-naming-convention.js ‚Ä¶ all appear to be one-off codemods.  Keep them in a tools folder or remove them after running; right now they clutter the production repo.

5. Backend observations
   ‚Ä¢ Logic looks mostly complete; controllers, routes, models, jobs and tests exist and reference each other consistently.  
   ‚Ä¢ The job framework is solid, but `notificationJob.js` still throws a ‚ÄúSimulated network error‚Äù 5 % of the time.  If this was only for stress-testing, remove it for production.
   ‚Ä¢ Environment validation (`config/envValidation.js`) aborts the server if required env vars are missing ‚Äì good, but remember to provide those vars in deployment or pipelines.  
   ‚Ä¢ Duplicate test folders:  backend/_tests_/ and backend/src/_tests_/ (different tests, so no crash, but consider consolidating).

6. ‚ÄúYet-to-be-implemented‚Äù items
   ‚Ä¢ CODE-SPLITTING-GUIDE.md and the dynamic-import hooks imply upcoming code-splitting, but nothing in App.js uses them.  
   ‚Ä¢ I18N-GUIDE.md is present; only a handful of components call `useTranslation`.  The majority of UI text is still hard-coded English.  
   ‚Ä¢ Accessibility utilities (src/lib/a11y.js, accessibility-checklist.md) exist, but no lint or CI step enforces them.

7. Potential runtime errors you will hit first
   ‚Ä¢ Module-not-found for any `../UI/‚Ä¶` import whose file still lives under ui/ (case mismatch).  
   ‚Ä¢ React-router will show a blank page beyond the placeholder header because routes to pages are not defined.  
   ‚Ä¢ Storybook stories import components from UI that may not exist.  
   ‚Ä¢ Front-end tests (`frontend/src/_tests_/*.test.js`) will fail for the same reasons.

8. Redundant / unused code
   ‚Ä¢ In userController.js the bcrypt import is commented out; either use it or delete the line.  
   ‚Ä¢ Many of the data-cleanup scripts and cron jobs write JSON snapshots into backend/src/data/.  If they are only for development, move them to a tmp / samples folder, otherwise they will bloat the repo.

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Recommended next steps

1. Pick one canonical UI component folder name (UI or ui), move all files there, and run the import-fix script or `eslint --fix`.
2. Delete the entire nested `frontend/frontend/` tree.
3. Wire real routes in App.js so the existing pages are reachable; move the page folders out of components/* if you plan a different structure.
4. Ensure every import in the codebase resolves (run `npm run lint` or `vite build` to surface missing files).
5. Decide which codemod scripts belong in the repo; move needed ones under tools/ and drop the rest.
6. Replace the 5 % simulated failure in `notificationJob` with a feature-flag or remove it entirely before production.
7. Complete code-splitting (lazy + suspense) and i18n rollout once routing is in place.
8. Add CI steps: linter, unit + integration tests, front-end build, and a duplicate-file / orphan-import check so the above issues can‚Äôt re-appear.

Addressing the duplicate directories and missing components will eliminate almost all immediate runtime errors; after that you can iterate on the larger architectural TODOs (code-splitting, full localisation, accessibility, etc.).

Below is a practical, repeat-able checklist for completing 

Step 1‚ÄÉ‚ÄúConsolidate the UI component folder and fix imports‚Äù  
Step 2‚ÄÉ‚ÄúRemove the accidental frontend/frontend sub-project‚Äù

I wrote it assuming you use git, Node 18+, and run commands from the workspace root on Windows. Adapt paths or commands if you work elsewhere.

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
STEP 1‚ÄÉChoose one casing for the UI component folder and make every import match
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

A. Decide the canonical name  
   ‚Ä¢ Because many files already import "../UI/‚Ä¶" (cap U) and you have a helper script (`frontend/scripts/fix-ui-imports.js`) that converts lower-case ‚Üí upper-case, choose **UI** as the final folder name.  
     (If you prefer lower-case, swap the roles of *UI* and *ui* in the instructions.)

B. Snapshot current state (always helpful)  
```powershell
git checkout -b chore/unify-ui-folder
git status
```

C. Inspect what you have today  
```powershell
# list both variants (PowerShell ‚Äì case-insensitive but still shows dupes)
Get-ChildItem frontend\src\components -Directory | Where-Object { $_.Name -match 'ui' }
```
You should see both `ui` and maybe an empty/partial `UI`.

D. Move/merge the files into UI/  
1. Ensure the target folder exists:  
   ```powershell
   mkdir frontend\src\components\UI 2>$null
   ```
2. Move everything that currently lives in the lower-case folder:  
   ```powershell
   robocopy frontend\src\components\ui frontend\src\components\UI /E
   ```
   (On macOS/Linux use `rsync -a`.)

3. Delete the now-empty lower-case folder:  
   ```powershell
   Remove-Item -Recurse -Force frontend\src\components\ui
   ```

   ‚ö†Ô∏è Windows/git case-change caveat  
   Git on Windows treats *ui* ‚Üí *UI* as a rename *only* if the path actually disappears and then re-appears in a commit. We forced that by deleting the old folder. No extra dance is required.

E. Fix every import pointing at ‚Äú‚Ä¶/ui/‚Äù  
   You already have a codemod:

   ```powershell
   node frontend\scripts\fix-ui-imports.js
   ```

   The script does three things:
   1. Replaces `"../ui/..."` with `"../UI/..."` in every *.js* file under frontend/src/**  
   2. Replaces `"./ui/..."` with `"./UI/..."` (same-dir imports)  
   3. Prints a ‚úÖ  summary

   If you decided to keep the lower-case variant instead, do a global search-replace (`../UI/` ‚Üí `../ui/`) or adapt the script.

F. Verify resolution & lint
```powershell
# Type-check / lint
cd frontend
npm install           # make sure deps are there
npm run lint          # or: npx eslint "src/**/*.{js,jsx}"
```
Fix any remaining ‚ÄúCannot resolve module ‚Ä¶/UI/‚Ä¶‚Äù or ESLint import errors manually.

G. Run unit tests and a dev build
```powershell
npm test
npm run build   # or: npm run dev / vite build / react-scripts build
```

H. Commit
```powershell
git add frontend/src/components/UI frontend/src/**/*.js
git commit -m "chore(frontend): consolidate UI component folder and fix imports"
```

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
STEP 2‚ÄÉDelete the accidental nested project at frontend/frontend/
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ

A. Confirm it is unused
```powershell
# Look for any imports outside the nested folder that point into it
rg -F "frontend/frontend" -g "*.{js,json,md}" -n
```
You should get **zero** hits. If you do see references, decide whether to move code out before deletion.

B. Remove the directory
```powershell
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force frontend\frontend
```
(or `rm -rf frontend/frontend` on *nix.)

C. Clean up any npm references  
If that nested folder contained its own `package.json`, you might still have `package-lock.json` artifacts or vscode workspace settings open. Deleting the folder is usually enough; but if you ever ran `npm install` inside it you may have duplicate node_modules:

```powershell
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force frontend\frontend\node_modules  # if still present
```

D. Verify nothing breaks
```powershell
# From repository root
npm test
npm run lint
npm -ws run build      # if you use workspaces, otherwise individual builds
```

E. Commit
```powershell
git add -u frontend/frontend
git commit -m "chore: remove obsolete nested frontend project"
```

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
POST-CLEANUP CHECKLIST
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
1. Push the branch and open a PR so CI runs:
   ```powershell
   git push -u origin chore/unify-ui-folder
   ```
2. Have reviewers look specifically for:
   ‚Ä¢ missing component files (404 on build)  
   ‚Ä¢ accidental deletion of assets/tests  
3. When merged, ask teammates to `git pull` and clear any local caches; module paths changed.

After these two steps the repo will have:
‚Äì A single, canonical `frontend/src/components/UI/` folder with all component files.  
‚Äì No stray `frontend/frontend/` project.  
‚Äì All import paths consistent, eliminating case-sensitivity bugs on Linux CI/CD and production hosts.

---

_**User**_

Implement the steps described in the guide previously created. Make sure to use windowns comands and choose UI as the final folder name

It looks like there might be some encoding issues with the files. Let's fix that by recreating them with proper encoding:

---

```diff
- import React from 'react';
- 
- /**
-  * Button component with various variants and sizes
-  */
- export const Button = React.forwardRef(
-   ({ className, variant, size, asChild, ...props }, ref) => {
-     const Comp = asChild ? React.Fragment : "button";
-     
-     const variantClasses = {
-       primary: "bg-blue-600 text-white hover:bg-blue-700 focus:ring-blue-500",
-       secondary: "bg-gray-200 text-gray-800 hover:bg-gray-300 focus:ring-gray-500 dark:bg-gray-700 dark:text-gray-100 dark:hover:bg-gray-600",
-       outline: "border border-gray-300 bg-transparent hover:bg-gray-100 focus:ring-gray-500 dark:border-gray-600 dark:hover:bg-gray-800",
-       ghost: "bg-transparent hover:bg-gray-100 focus:ring-gray-500 dark:hover:bg-gray-800",
-       link: "bg-transparent text-blue-600 hover:underline focus:ring-blue-500 dark:text-blue-400 p-0 h-auto",
-       danger: "bg-red-600 text-white hover:bg-red-700 focus:ring-red-500",
-       success: "bg-green-600 text-white hover:bg-green-700 focus:ring-green-500",
-       warning: "bg-yellow-500 text-white hover:bg-yellow-600 focus:ring-yellow-500"
-     };
-     
-     const sizeClasses = {
-       xs: "h-6 px-2 text-xs",
-       sm: "h-8 px-3 text-sm",
-       md: "h-10 px-4 text-sm",
-       lg: "h-12 px-6 text-base",
-       xl: "h-14 px-8 text-lg",
-       icon: "p-2"
-     };
-     
-     const baseClasses = "inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-md font-medium transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:opacity-50 disabled:pointer-events-none";
-     
-     const classes = [
-       baseClasses,
-       variantClasses[variant || "primary"],
```

```diff
-   gradient = false,
```

```diff
  // Table component placeholder
+ 
+ export const Table = ({ children, ...props }) => {
+   return (
+     <table className="table" {...props}>
+       {children}
+     </table>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export const TableHeader = ({ children, ...props }) => {
+   return <thead {...props}>{children}</thead>;
+ };
+ 
+ export const TableBody = ({ children, ...props }) => {
+   return <tbody {...props}>{children}</tbody>;
+ };
+ 
+ export const TableRow = ({ children, ...props }) => {
+   return <tr {...props}>{children}</tr>;
+ };
+ 
+ export const TableHead = ({ children, ...props }) => {
+   return <th {...props}>{children}</th>;
+ };
+ 
+ export const TableCell = ({ children, ...props }) => {
+   return <td {...props}>{children}</td>;
+ };
  
```
